reviewText:
If you have never played a Heroes of Might and Magic game, shame on you.  This series spans back to my early childhood.    The Heroes game I played the most  was WOG, a custom expansion for HoM&M3.  I loved this series and logged countless hours into these games.  They are indepth yet easy to pick up, hard most of the time unless you are a seasond vet.

Build up your town.  Recruit Troops (this version allows upto 7th level units). Upgrade your buildings to get bounses, like resorces, spells, or your creature dwelling. In HoMM5 you can select from 2 differant upgrades for each creature type.  You have a army that is lead by your hero(s).  On the map you will be just one person, but if you attack a creature stack or another player the map closes in and you switch to battle.  This is simalar to RPGs where u wander around a map and you trigger combat then cut screen, there is your party ready to kick some butt.

This game allows may differant types of combonations with town faction/hero selection/creature types/pre-gen maps/campain.

New Features include the single player campain where you play as the orcs, and i think the 'caravans' are new to this expainsion.  Caravans can be selected where you hire creatures and there u selecet where you want your guys from and the caravans will farry you troops from creature dwellings or even other towns.

I must also point out this game does have some flaws.  First I mention the AI, to be honest the AI in heroes games has never been the best and this game is no exception. Many people claim that the normal setting is Comp doesn't even try" (Yes they will even not capture resorce nodes
date: and be crippled by larger maps).  Also people claim the hard setting is "Comp Cheats way to much". Don't be upset
recommended: they are fan made mods that tweeks the AI so its more cunning and less cheating.  The random map generator built into the game is poor compaired to previous games.  Lack of teams is the biggest issuse
hoursPlayed: for multi player games.  If your playing single player the random map gen is fine. NOTE: the time for the computer to move on random maps seems to take extreamly long time even with a 'newer' computer.  YET AGAIN
voteText: fans of the Heroes games shine through as I have found 2 other random map gens
helpfulPercent: I've only used one and it worked great
votesHelpful: but the comp lag remaind.\n\nThe best things I like about this game
votesFunny: the gfx (not the best but better then earlyer Heroes)
column16: smooth when combined with arrow keys)
column17: balance (like most heroes games there is no horrid balance issuses)
column18: and the community (you will have to resort to the web for forums

reviewText:
This is one of the greatest games that I've ever played.

The campaign mode offers a rich story that follows on from previous HoMM titles and provides quite a challenge on heroic difficulty.  The multiplayer mode has incredible replayablity,  offering players a choice from a vast selection of heroes, each with various strengths and weaknesses. There's a good selection of maps to play, as well as a lot of user created maps to download.  This is certainly a game that's easy to learn but hard to master.

One of the best turn based strategy games out there. Highly recommend.

reviewText: If you like turn based strategy games, get this game. The story is a continuation of the first one's (which was very good)  and the mechanics that run the game are well made. You can even play the game online either against other players or coop with your friends. It also has a built in mode online called Duel mode where you and your opponent each get a premade fully developed army and fight to the death with them. It is very quick and alot of fun to play as each of the heros are well balanced and have there own quirks in this mode. If you feel ambitious you can even make your own armies for duel mode and even custom campaigns and maps with the map editor. It is a very fun title and has given me hours of enjoyment. I highly recommend it. XD

reviewText: I think Tribes Of The East is very good. I was disappointed by Hammers Of Fate (too short campaign, too simple and uninteresting new faction), but Tribes Of The East is a very successful extension. Orcs are really nice to play (new fighting tactics with the rage of blood), are very beautiful. The three campaigns are very catchy, and it feels good to replay the necropolis and good old Zehir (always so charismatic ! ). The game is moreover a stand-alone allowing to discover the world of Heroes of Might & Magic V. Great achievement !\n16/20

reviewText:
TL,DR: Treats Heroes 3 itch, but doesn't offer much new.

Pros:
- good 'ole Heroes 3 with expanded hero and creature skill system
- a bit too cartoonish, but still very solid and stylish graphics and overall design
- every faction is very different gameplay-wise due to new global racial ability system

Cons:
- too many crucial things are random-based, way too many for a TBS
- low variety of interactive nodes on the map: either a guarded treasury, a permanent or temporary + to some stat or an outdoor variety of some sort of a town building. Some challenged nodes like +1 luck to all owner's heroes" or an architect's hut that gives some discount on buildings in owner's towns or allows to build twice per day would be nice. Alas
- Overabundance of creature abililies makes combat very varied
date: but you'll have no idea what many of those abilities actually do even when you use them
recommended:
because their effects are not stated anywhere in the game. There is a fan-made manual for that though.
- AI is not very I
- Random map generator is still quite glitchy

P.S. Too bad Heroes 6 went over the top and treated Heroes 5's two sore fingers by chopping the whole leg off."

reviewText: I have played the originial Heroes of Might and Magic, Heroes of Might & Magic 3: The Shadow of Death, and even a bit of the newer Heroes of Might and Magic VI, and I have to say this is by far my favorite one so far.  Heroes of Might and Magic V was a great game, and this only adds on to it in many ways.  Some of the major additions is the two types of each tier of soldiers that you can recruit, and of course adding an additional faction, the Orcs, while not losing many of the great features in Heroes V that were lost in the Hammers of Fate Expansion.  Still a very challenging game overall, but well done.  Definitely recomend it, especially if you liked the original Heroes V.

reviewText:
HOMM 5 is a very special case in the book of 'How-To-Age-Quicker', where it consumes more time then you thought it did. The only game before it (for me) was HOMM 3, And no, not the peice of s**t HD remake, but the original, CD PORT.

HOMM on its own was a really shallow lot of cool but also very bland gameplay, enjoyable but not mindblowing amazement, however, this expansion to the HOMM 5 library makes every nerve in my body tingle. Not only do we have stronghold which is now probably the most amazing race to play, but overall,  has a fun mechanic which rewards you for being aggressive as all hell.

In short, it's a must buy for anyone who has any patience and love strategic games, I believe anyone can get into this game in particular. HOMM 3 can't do that to people, that takes nerves and a lot of spare time. Crack this one open when you are bored, you learn the mechanics in literal seconds, and you're good to go.

GR8 game m8 8/10
